newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil shares end off on lack of news, trade weak.
newsitem.headline: Brazil shares end off on lack of news, trade weak.

text.p: Brazilian stocks closed down 1.04 percent on one of the weakest daily volumes of the year as some local investors took advantage of a lull in market-moving news to take profits, brokers said.
"The bolsa was at a standstill today," one dealer said. "It was lifeless."
The Sao Paulo bourse's Bovespa index of 52 most traded shares shed 659 points to close at 62,489 points on meager turnover of 245 million reais.
Brokers said most blue chips declined in light trade, hit by mild profit-taking, as neither the Argentine or Brazilian Congress produced news and regional stock markets remained largely calm.
"There was no perspective, no trend today," one broker said. "There was no definition on Argentine's fiscal situation and our Congress do anything on reforms."
Prices suffered from the lack of interest in Brazilian shares with trade, as usual, focused on Telebras, dealers said.
Its benchmark preferred ended off 0.92 percent at 75.60 percent, while the common fell 1.78 percent to 60.60 reais.
Among the session's few gainers, Companhia Vale do Rio Doce, the federally owned mining giant, rose 0.86 percent to 18.66 reais.
The bolsa's Electrical Energy Index (IEE) of nine most-liquid power shares followed other shares downward, dropped 1.95 percent to end at 1,547 points.
State-owned power firm Eletrobras's preferred B dropped 1.75 percent to close at 280.00 reais.
